resources.string: As we wrap up our first tour of Eastern Uganda, I would like to send a special thank you message to all who came to share with me. I am deeply humbled by your commitment to the message of change.

I would also like to sympathise with all those peaceful Ugandans that assembled to hear the message and who suffered the effects from teargas and unnecessary police violence. Specifically the people of Soroti and Jinja.

I will be heading to Northern Uganda next week and hope to share with you on a number of pertinent issues affecting the region and how we can Go Forward to build a better, stronger, prosperous Uganda.
I would like to thank the entire population of Busoga for the warm welcome I received yesterday. It is humbling to see the solidarity we had despite the heavy police deployment.
The consultative meeting did indeed take place at the Nile Village Hotel after numerous efforts by the Uganda Police to sabotage each arrangement that the team put in place.
